snippet: An expensive new requirement has led to a dearth of contestants at the America’s Cup, and San Francisco leaders are raising doubts about the race’s benefits for the city amid lagging interest.
abstract: New expensive design requirement for 2013 America's Cup has led to dearth of contestants, and San Francisco leaders are raising doubts about race's benefits for host city amid lagging interest; with just weeks left before start of competition, only four teams have signed up because of costs, smallest contingent in race's modern history and far fewer than 15 organizers had predicted in selling event to city officials hungry for its economic benefits.
lead_paragraph: An expensive new requirement has led to a dearth of contestants at the America’s Cup, and San Francisco leaders are raising doubts about the race’s benefits for the city amid lagging interest.

headline.seo: America’s Cup Sailing Race Faces Challenges in San Francisco
headline.main: When Billionaire Sets Rules, It’s an Exclusive Race
headline.print_headline: When Billionaire Sets Rules, It’s Exclusive Race
